stanza.line: That you were once unkind befriends menow
And for that sorrow which I then didfeel
Needs must I under my transgressionbow
Unless my nerves were brass or hammeredsteel
For if you were by my unkindnessshaken
As I by yours yhave passed a hell oftime
And I a tyrant have no leisuretaken
To weigh how once I suffered in yourcrime
O that our night of woe might haveremembered
My deepest sense how hard true sorrowhits
And soon to you as you to me thentendered
The humble salve which wounded bosomsfits
But that your trespass now becomes afee
Mine ransoms yours and yours must ransomme
